required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The study evaluates the effect of theophylline in 40 subjects with Pseudohypoparathyroidism.

detailed_description.textblock: It is an open label intervention study for the off-label use of theophylline in psuedohypoparathyroidism (PHP).Theophylline is a is non-specific phosphodiesterase inhibitor which increases the levels of secondary messenger,cAMP. PHP patients have end organ resistance to hormones involving cAMP signaling. Thus, theophylline has a potential to abrogate hormone resistance. Also, it may have a role in bone maturation, neurocognition and metabolism.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open label intervention study, off label use of theophylline

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of Theophylline on Bone Age in PHP
primary_outcome.description: Change in Bone age ( in years and months) before and after theophylline administration for 52 weeks

arm_group.arm_group_label: Single arm open labeled intervention study
arm_group.description: Subjects with PHP will be given theophylline to decrease the end organ resistance by increasing levels of cAMP, a second messenger. Theophylline will be dosed twice a day for a period of 52 weeks.

intervention.description: Theophylline will be given to maintain a peak level between 10-15 mcg/mL
intervention.arm_group_label: Single arm open labeled intervention study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with known diagnosis of PHP1A and PHP1B
- Age >5 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ Significant kidney disease, i.e. any CKD stage
- Hypercalciuria
- Kidney stones
- Severe Heart disease
- Uncontrolled seizure disorder
- Peptic ulcer
- Liver dysfunction
- Bleeding disorder
- Allergy to theophylline preparation
- Muscle disorder
- Infection
- Any neurologic disease
- Chronic drugs interacting with theophylline

responsible_party.investigator_title: Medical Director, Division of Pediatric Nephrology
